definition: nobody is perfect/everyone has their defect

sentences.english: Being human, we are imperfect. That's why we need each other.
sentences.chinese: 人无完人，因此，我们需要彼此帮助。

sentences.english: Nobody’s perfect. You’re bound to make mistakes, especially when you’re just starting out.
sentences.chinese: 人无完人，你一定会犯错的，特别是刚刚开始的时候。

sentences.english: Don’t expect perfection in everything you see.
sentences.chinese: 别指望事事完美，毕竟人无完人。

sentences.english: Like I said, it’s tough, but I’m far from perfect and even make mistakes every now and then.
sentences.chinese: 正如我所说，这很难，但人无完人谁能无错？
接受彼此的不同，因为人无完人。

definition: not all gold is sufficiently red (idiom); no-one is perfect
lit. for some things a foot may be too short, and for the other an inch will suffice (proverb)/fig. everyone has their strong and weak points/everything has its advantages and disadvantages
pinyin: chi3 you3 suo3 duan3 , cun4 you3 suo3 chang2

definition: lit. to blow apart the hairs upon a fur to discover any defect (idiom); fig. to be fastidious/nitpick
to recognize one's mistakes and be able to reform oneself (idiom)
lit. in the eyes of a lover appears 西施[Xi1 shi1] (idiom); fig. beauty is in the eye of the beholder
pinyin: qing2 ren2 yan3 li3 chu1 Xi1 shi1

definition: to err/to make a mistake/to do the wrong thing
see 求全責備|求全责备[qiu2 quan2 ze2 bei4]
lit. a blemish does not obscure jade's luster/the pros outweigh the cons (idiom)
correct any mistakes you made, but maintain your good record if you did not make them (idiom)
pinyin: you3 ze2 gai3 zhi1 , wu2 ze2 jia1 mian3
